result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zachary J Piontek

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Zachary J Piontek in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case calendared for a Plea and Sentencing Hearing.
Defense counsel request an adjournment advising the court he need more time to complete plea documents with the client and defendant need time to enroll in treatment. 
Defense advised to file plea documents 24 hours in advance of the hearing. Court will accept case 21CT1593 for purposes of a global resolution. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Zachary J Piontek in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense requested a plea and sentencing date. Court is open for global resolution for defendant's 2021CT1593 case. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 05.4.2022

Defendant Zachary J Piontek in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Defendant Zachary J Piontek in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

22RM012497  Actual Date Bond Posted with * Sheriff
2/21/2022

Defendant Zachary J Piontek not in court, defendant in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Zachary J Piontek not in court, defendant in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Zachary J Piontek in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Zachary J Piontek in custody.  Matthew Richard Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Zachary J Piontek appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.    Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
